It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to specific regions in the southwestern United States, where it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
